Prior to 2007, ZIKV had silently circulated in many countries from African and Asian continents with a low impact on public health. However, during the recent emergence, different transmission routes have been reported, and the epidemic profile and self-limiting character of Zika disease were dramatically altered.
3 After ZIKV introduction to Brazil, the virus raged on in South America and caused debilitating neurological and congenital complications, resulting in significant acute morbidity in adult patients and devastating neurological sequelae in newborns.
